relation: OK Jenson, that’s good. Let’s start to cool the car. Cool the car and Yellow G10. OK Jenson, test your drinks. Test your drinks.
And Kevin, would you like a front-wing change?
No, stay as we are. Stay as we are.
Please check the right-rear brake. There’s a lot of smoke coming out of it, there must’ve been a small fire.
OK Daniel, around to the grid please. Around to the grid.
OK Jenson, that’s good. The guys will meet you at the back of the grid.
OK, stay at the back of the grid.
OK, I remind you, box, box. If you can get some temperature in the tyres, that would be good. Bottas is around ten seconds behind.
Cool engine. Standard up-shift. Cool engine, standard up-shift and on to grid.
OK Jules, go to grid. Go to grid. And clutch nine, please Jules. Clutch nine and we push you into position.
Switch off all cooling fans for the national anthem.
OK, so just confirm. Pit limiter on, should be in mode 12. RS mode lower RS only. Blend four. Torque one and pre-select blend.
So to confirm, go clutch seven from the dummy grid. His procedure was good.
And radio check, Nico. This is Rich.
Radio loud and clear. Much better than Tony.
And main thing on the lap to grid – temperature, as I say, in the front brakes. And just do everything you can to keep temperatures in the brakes and the front tyres.
Maldonado having difficulty with his dashboard display. One thing – the light on the screen is very poor. I can’t see the numbers. Is more than normal. There is something wrong there.
Do you expect the grip level to be lower on the grid than in the pitlane?
Drivers give feedback on their practice starts. Not much initial torque. Too little initial torque.
Copy that, Nico. I’ll feed that back. Too much initial torque.
Oh, not too much, too little. Too little.
And clutch eight. Clutch eight. All systems are good. Gearbox is good.
Start was not so good. Was under-engaged, I think?
And Jenson, brakes are good. Brakes are good, no more warming on the brakes. No more warming. And yellow G3. Yellow G3.
Can we keep the clutch setting?
Yeah, so torque three. Torque three with the engine. Two tyre warming.
OK Jenson. And launch map on. Launch map on.
Massa has collided with Raikkonen’s car following a crash on the Wellington Straight and is driving back to the pits with damage. OK Felipe, are you OK? Felipe, are you OK?
I can come back like that? Let me know, otherwise I stop.
The race is red-flagged following Raikkonen’s crash. Vergne and Perez collided at turn one. Tell us if you have got damage in the front wing, Jev?
Not sure. I’m not really sure damage, I’ve not seen anything flying.
That will be box, Jev. Box for front wing and tyres.
Hamilton made minor contact with Vettel at Village at the start Steering feels a little bit light. Just please check the front wing and if I’ve got any damage on the rest of my car.
Bring spare parts just in case, guys.
Copy that, Lewis. We’re on it.

OK, check the front-left corner, in terms of numbers. I had a little bit of touch with Hamilton’s wheel. Also, I will drive by close to the pit wall, so If you could stand out and have a good look. I don’t think it’s damaged, but if you could have a good look.
Yeah, what happened on the launch?
Basically, I throw the first clutch and nothing happened. I had no torque at all. And then I throw the second one to try and see… and basically nothing happened.
The race will be restarted behind the Safety Car. That’s our information at the moment.
Kobayashi was also involved in the Raikkonen crash. Please look at my car. On the straight, I hit with the Ferrari because… I try to avoid it, I went to gras but… I don’t know. I’m not sure.

Chilton’s car was damaged in the Raikkonen accident and he came into the pits at the end of lap one, under the red flag. I know you’ve probably got a thousand things to worry about, but if this red goes on much longer, then obviously the race is going to go on longer and there’s more time for that rain coming at the rain. So maybe go hard, run long and hope for the rain? It’s one less stop, but it’s down to you.
Max, we copy everything you say but we’re happy with our strategy at the minute, please. Thank you.
Is the wind direction the same today?
Lewis, this is Jockey. Very similar to yesterday. It’s come round about 20 degrees. It’s now directly right to left along Hangar Straight. As you see it from right to left.
OK Jock. What’re your thoughts on front wing? And then…
Down half a turn on front flap is what Bono [Peter Bonnington] and I agreed. I’m happy with that.
Diff mode, stay where you are I think, at the moment. Just to make you aware…
Interrupting Am I allowed to go up to the five?

You are going to do another start procedure before the start of this race. You’re gonna start behind the Safety Car, but you are going to do a bite-point find as soon as you fire up and then go strat mode five and then RS modes will be on and then you’ll launch off the grid.
OK. And for this lap? What do I do strat wise?
So you’ll be in strat mode five and we’ll run the brake magic until I tell you to get it off.
Gonna be start behind the Safety Car, yeah?

That’s correct. So it’ll be start just like we did in… it was… yeah, Monaco. Start behind the Safety Car, we’ll go around, do a lap, the Safety Car will come in and then that is virtually lap two of the race – this is lap one of the race. So for info, don’t forget you can overtake from that Safety Car line.
And just give me as much info as I need in terms of tyres, etc. Warm up and temps.
Understood. I think you can give them a pretty good work out on this lap.
After an hour long delay, the race resumes under Safety Car And remember, ten car lengths behind Safety Car.
Brakes are starting to come up now. Just need to work them a little bit more. Tyres are nine front, eight and a half rear.
And Jenson, Yellow G3. Yellow G3 and Safety Car in this lap. Safety Car in this lap.
The race has now restarted Torque seven for running. Torque seven for running. And will be in this lap for drive-through penalty. Build tyre temps, build front tyre temps.
Hamilton has passed Magnussen for third OK Lewis, so Nico 4.5 seconds ahead.
OK, good job Jev. Now close the gap with Grosjean ahead.
We’re on the bottom of the state of store, no overtake. No overtake.
Max, second sector was one second quicker than Jules. Third sector was one second quicker, so you are catching the pack. Good job.
And remember, try slower in for better exit. Gap, 5.4.
The Mercedes drivers get their usual information about each others’ driving techniques. OK Lewis, gap now 5.4. Loss to Nico, braking, turn six [Brooklands].
By lap seven Rosbreg is almost 14 seconds ahead of third-placed Button, with Hamilton between them. So Nico, you are in your Safety Car window.
OK, so try an earlier and faster apex in turn 15 [Stowe].
So Nico braking later, turn 15. And half tenth faster, sector one. Gap at 5.5. You are in your Safety Car window.
Warning – on corner 18 [Club], we have to stay on the track on corner 18.
Ricciardo passed Hulkenberg on lap nine. OK mate, nice job. Let’s get after Alonso.
Gutierrez has collided with Maldonado at Vale Is the car OK, Esteban?
No reply is heard from Gutierrez’s car – but he can be heard crunching through a gravel trap and into retirement. Understood, is it just the front wing?
OK Checo, so this is the Bianchi, Vergne, Grosjean, Maldonado train ahead, OK? So it’s Bianchi at the head of these three cars ahead of you.
Ericsson is cruising with apparent suspension damage I have a damaged car. Front suspension, left.
OK, roger. If it’s safe to bring it back, bring it back.
Still yellow, yellow, turn one, two [Abbey/Farm]. Be more progressive with the steering, turns one and two. And be aware, fuel is to target, but you do not have excess. We’re just safe at the moment.
At the next stop, what are you thinking on front wing?
I have no idea. Because we have got two big issues. I don’t know.
Copy that. We’re fighting the wind, I think. It’s the wind.
Well maybe I should take more flaps, because the high-speed understeer is absolutely killing us. I can handle the stability with my torque and engine braking.
Copy that Nico. Watch the track limits in turn nine [Copse]. Track limits, turn nine.
OK, Jenson. Let’s work the front-left tyre a little harder, if you can. More temperature in the front-left.
So two tenths faster, sector two. So pitting the hards for the next stint, we’re thinking one turn down, maybe one and a half. Let me know what you think.
Rosberg made his first pit stop on lap 18. So Nico we may extend one more lap. Just let us know how the tyres are looking, look like they’re coming back a little bit.
Copy, we’re going to go one more lap.
Great job, Max. It was a 44.4 from Kobayashi. He’s within reach, let’s get him in the next lap or two.
Ricciardo pits for the only time in the race. You’ll come out behind Sutil, ahead of Vergne. Maybe close behind Sutil.
OK Lewis you’re the fastest man on track.
So Vettel ahead’s on a two stop anyway, Nico. So let’s settle down and try and make this one work.
Having started 14th Bottas has just passed Button for third behind the two Mercedes. Brilliant stuff, Valtteri.
So push hard now, Nico. Push hard now. It won’t be long.
So we’re going to be target, plus two. Target plus two. You are one tenth faster, sector one.
OK Lewis, three tenths faster sector one. It’s hammer time.
Tyres are OK. Tyres are OK.
Great management, Valtteri. To safeguard our day we need to run this tyre right to the end of its life. So how many laps do you think left?
Difficult to get the exact [unclear] so, I think the wear is OK. So, could be up to ten laps.
Copy, good feedback. We’ll just keep an eye on lap times. That’s good news.
Next car in front is Jev, four seconds. Use the hards for him – 41.5 last timed lap. Forty-one point five.
The first sign of the problem which eventually caused Rosberg’s retirement. Gearbox problem on the downshift.
OK Daniel. Hulkenberg ahead is one-stopping. Need to get past him as soon as possible.
So we’re continuing to look at the problem, Nico. No information at the moment.
Pace much better. You’re much closer to Maldonado now.
You have now jumped a lot of cars ahead. We’re looking good. Nice job, mate.
What about tyres? Tyre phase and balance?
All good. Car now is a little bit too much on the nose, so 1.4 [unclear].
Behind Vergne is clear, he’s on two stops. His tyres are seven laps old Mediums.
So tyres were evenly worn front and rear. Front a little bit more – 50 percent remaining.
So, menu ten to one. Change to gearbox settings should be transparent. Menu ten to one.
Tyres are starting to drop off.
OK copy that message, Lewis. One more lap. One more lap.
This is a good in-lap, Lewis. Just keep on it.
OK Daniel. Everybody ahead will have to stop again. Three cars will have to fit hards and they will be slow. Three cars ahead will fit hards.
The last two laps, Alonso’s gone off the circuit at Copse.
OK Jenson, understood. Understood. Doing a great job.
OK Jenson, Yellow G3. Yellow G3. Target plus two.

While Rosberg put on mediums again at his first pit stop, Hamilton switched to the hards. Although hewas warned they would take a while to warm up his first full lap out of the pits turned out to be the fastest of the race. OK Lewis, this tyre has a warm-up slope on the outlap, so we suggest diff entry five for this tyre. Diff entry five.
Don’t worry about the pit stops, guys. But let’s get a good one next one, OK?
OK Jenson, so we are still looking for target plus two. Alonso’s pitted but has a five second stop-go, so this is all good.
So Lewis pushing very hard at the moment. Consider brake balance rearwards for ten to 13. Gap to Lewis, 4.8.
And HPP4 position ten when you can. Another nine-tenths that last lap. Gap at 3.2.
Rosberg’s gearbox fails into Village, allowing Hamilton through into the lead Problem on the upshift at turn eight [Woodcote].
Copy, understood. We’re looking at it.
Consider slowing me down just to get me to the finish line?
Copy that, Nico. We will advise. No change at the moment on gearbox settings.
Cause I could stop shifting so much, if you need to.
OK, really having big problems with the gearbox so please advise. Staying in fifth gear at the moment. I lost it again on downshifting.
Some of these messages may not be in chronological order as they were edited differntly on different channels. So Nico menu ten to eight and leave it in eight.
Stay in sixth, Nico. Stay in sixth.
Yeah, I don’t have drive at the moment.
If you don’t have drive, try shifting Nico.
OK Lewis, Nico is reporting a gearbox issue. He has a shift problem. So don’t take any risks.
OK Lewis, so Nico is trying to get this car home. So take no risks. Just caution with the traffic.
OK Lewis, so gap to the car in third place in 24 seconds.
OK, I’m trying everything. Anything else I can do?
OK, not at the moment. We’re still looking.
Stand by. So we’ve got about thirty seconds before we need to turn off, Nico…
Twenty seconds before we need to turn off…
OK, so stop stop. Turn off. Stop, stop. Turn off, Nico. Going to save the engine.
OK Lewis just look after the car as much as you can. Yellow, yellow, Maggotts/Becketts. I’m afraid Nico’s had to stop.
How’s our pace? Is it worth going longer?
We are looking into it, we are looking into your question.
Yep, pace is still good. You’re now the second quickest car on track. Rosberg has retired.
So for info, Vettel ahead is on 21-lap old used [medium tyres], so he has to stop again. So in reality, we’re in P2. So keep your head down, we need to get to the end.
Try to go forwards on bias if you can. It might help the rear temps. We don’t need that help for reliability, just for tyre temps. It might help tyre temps.
Nico, so we’re 20 laps to go. You should be able to push these [tyres] all the way to the end.

So Max, for the race situation, because we were in the pit-lane we missed that extra formation lap, which put us one lap down to the field. So we are one lap down to Jules, we’ll keep pushing to the end, hopefully we can catch back up to Kobayashi and regain that position and we’ll keep pushing and take positions as other people go out. Sorry for the situation but you’re doing a great job, keep pushing.

Kobayashi is about 70 percent of a lap ahead. Kobayashi’s in turn four [The Loop] now. So we need to make that up to him, but he’s lapping much slower so we’ll see how we’re doing pace wise and he’ll hopefully be stopping again.
Perez passed Sutil on lap 37. C’mon Checo, let’s try and get him [Sutil] nice and early. So he doesn’t disrupt our rhythm.
Watch overlaying brake and throttle. Watch overlaying brake and throttle.

While Vettel pitted on lap 10 and had to make another pit stop to get to the end, Ricciardo’s first pit stop was on lap 15 and he felt able to make his tyres last until the flag. Daniel, do you think you can do 15 more laps? Do you think you can do 15 more laps on this set?
Sutil is going wide in turn nine [Copse] all the time.
Copy that. Good info. Thank you.
Vettel came out of the pits ahead of Alonso on lap 34 but was passed by the driver, who defended vigorously when Vettel attacked him back. He can’t do that! I would’ve crashed into him!
Understood. You’ve got plenty of laps. Let’s do it again.
Alonso complains in Eng-talian. Track limits a tutti, eh? [Track limits for all, eh?]
What’s going on with the brakes again? I mean, how can I race?
We are pushing for you, we are looking into it. Keep racing as good as you can.
Understood. Track limits for everyone and the car behind [Vettel] included.
So Jenson, Ricciardo on 24-lap-old tyres. You’re currently six tenths faster than Ricciardo. Six tenths faster.
These tyres are pretty good. There’s a lot of life left in them.
Are you happy with the tyre energies? For me it feels OK.
For sure. Don’t push any harder than this. We’re in a safe position.
OK Jenson. We think Ricciardo will try and get to the end. We think he will try and get to the end, so we need to chase him down and pass him on track.
Pace is good. You’re doing a very good job. Gap to Button – nine seconds. Still nine seconds to Button. He’s doing 39.0s.
…and another one. So track limits, Alonso. Went wide again.
Understood. You need to use the charge. Either charge ten or use overtake. One or the other.
Appears to be in reference to the pair going side-by-side into Copse on lap 42. He didn’t leave a space! I could’ve easily given him a puncture!
Understood. Stay patient. You’re clearly quicker.
OK Daniel, you do not need to look after the right-hand side tyres. You can push in left-hand corners. Push in the left-hand corners.
And we are reporting track limits to the race direction.
OK Daniel, pace management is good at the moment. You’re doing a good job at the moment. Button will not catch you.
OK Kevin, ten laps to go. Tyres are good, we can push more. Let’s close up on Vettel and Alonso, see if we can get them in the end.
OK, still half a second faster. Still half a second faster. We are catching him [Hulkenberg].
Daniel, if you can maintain a 39.2, Button will not catch you. If you can maintain 39.2, it will be easy.
Yeah, temps are looking better now. Just keep working at it.
OK Daniel, should be easy, but don’t let him get DRS. Do not let him get within DRS. We need to keep a good five second margin.

Vettel finally passed Alonso after another close encounter between the pair at Brooklands, which appears to be what he is referring to here. He did the same thing again! He can’t do that! If I don’t move out of the way, he’s launching me off the track!
Good job. OK Sebastian, five laps to go. Button ahead, 39.0.

While Vettel was complaining about Alonso, Alonso was complaining about Vettel. He takes the DRS thanks to the track limits at the last corner! He take the DRS out of turn five [Aintree] and out of turn nine [Copse]! Either way! What more I need to do?
That is clear. That is clear.
Yes and he got the position immediately! Immediately! If not five seconds at the end of the race… [edited]
Some of these messages may not be in chronological order as they were edited differntly on different channels. I need to get back the position immeditately.
Jenson this is really good. Currently more than one second a lap faster than Ricciardo.
OK Daniel, three laps to go. Button’s last lap was a 38.5. Gap is now four seconds. Four seconds gap. Pick up the pace a little bit.
The burning smell was likely Maldonado’s smoking engine ahead Check the brakes, because I can smell something. I can smell something burning.
Maldonado has pulled off circuit with a smoking engine Stop the car please, Pastor. Stop the car. Stop the car.
Maldonado ahead may be leaking oil. May be oil from Maldonado car ahead of you.
OK Jenson, this is the last lap. Starting the last lap. Big grandstand finish, JB.
OK Lewis exercise a bit of caution sector three, may be some oil down. Maldonado stopped turn one [Abbey], there is a yellow there.
You can’t touch this, Lewis! Home grand prix win! Beautiful work. Lap it up boy!
England! What a great feeling guys! I couldn’t be happier. I’m sorry about yesterday but fantastic job today, this weekend, as always.
Great drive Lewis! Fantastic drive, really controlled. Well done!
Hamilton celebrated with doughnuts on his return to the pits. OK Lewis, let’s look after this motor. We need it again.

Wow! We said this morning, Valterri, that was going to be fun, but I don’t know where you pulled that one from. That was absolutely unbelieveable! Great recovery by the whole team after difficult weekend, especially yesterday. But absolutely unbelievable drive. Well done!
Yes! [Laughs] Thank you. Thank you guys. Every single one. At the factory, at Mercedes, in the race team. Thank you, thank you, thank you. We’re on the right way.
Nice job. I could tell you wanted to one stop all weekend, mate!
Nice. Last lap couldn’t have come sooner!
He made us sweat a little bit, last lap!
That’s a great drive. Such a shame we just missed out on the end there. But a great drive. I think at the beginning of the weekend, we’d have taken P4, so top job Jenson.
In his 15th British Grand Prix Button once again failed to finish on the podium, crossing the line less than a second behind third-placed Ricciardo. [Sighs] He was one more lap! One more lap…

Yeah, I know. I know. It’s incredibly Frustrating. I think for the whole weekend, we deserved it as well. But, never mind. P4 is a good result and, yeah. It’s been a nice day. So, Lewis won the race. Bottas had a very impressive race from where he qualified and was second. Ricciardo obviously just ahead of us third. We were fourth. Vettel and Alonso had a big battle and Vettel won that, so P5. Alonso P6. Kevin seventh. Hulkenberg eighth and the two Toro Rossos Kvyat and Vergne ninth and tenth.

Yeah, it was a tough old race. Strange with the different tyres. The variety of them was much better with us – I don’t know why that is. Just general grip. Less movement with the tyre – I guess that’s why.
Yep, OK. Understood. I think, yeah, our pace on the Hards was not too bad at all.
Alright, good job Sebastian. Sorry mate. We picked the wrong one there. You’re P5. We decided to keep Daniel out. So Daniel did one stop. He’s P3.
Yep. I saw that. Did what we could from where we were. But.. yeah. Decided for the wrong one then.
Your move on Fernando… I tell you what… big set of balls to go wheel-to-wheel with him through Woodcote. So, I mean, that was move of the race there. Move of the race.

We finished in P7. Pretty tough race. Obviously we had quite a bit of traffic and I think that maybe hurt our tyres a bit. But I think you did a good solid job. We’ll have a look and see if there’s anything else we can do better.
Good job Nico. So P8. P8. That was a good job, that.
Yeah, cheers guys today. Unbelieveable. It’s [unclear] like it was on Friday. It’s so difficult to drive. We just need to get on top of that.
P9, Daniil. P9. Well done, well done. Very good race.
OK guys. I gave it everything. I gave it all I could.
Yeah, we saw that. We saw that. We all think that you did a very good job. Well done, well done.
Vergne took a point having been 18th at the restart. OK Jev. Good job, despite the problems at the first start. Car in the points. Very good drive. Very good, solid drive.

Have they lost everything. I remember what stress Sutil put on the word ‘again’. Since 2012 they followed McLaren into the abyss., 143403=PorscheF1 (@xtwl) said on 9th July 2014, 20:56, 135331=Max Jacobson (@vettel1) said on 10th July 2014, 11:48, 102623=Alonso said on 9th July 2014, 13:24, 132190=Keith Campbell (@keithedin) said on 9th July 2014, 21:32, 98686=Atticus (@atticus-2) said on 9th July 2014, 14:09, 117633=Jack (@jmc200) said on 9th July 2014, 15:19, 130305=MtlRacer (@mtlracer) said on 9th July 2014, 21:31, 87389=Joshua Mesh (@joshua-mesh) said on 9th July 2014, 12:24, 90552=Keith Collantine (@keithcollantine) said on 9th July 2014, 13:24, 115819=LexBlair (@lexblair) said on 9th July 2014, 15:24, 88992=AmbroseRPM (@ambroserpm) said on 9th July 2014, 12:45, 122424=MtlRacer (@mtlracer) said on 9th July 2014, 17:21, 125457=Frasier (@frasier) said on 9th July 2014, 18:44, 109277=Robbie (@robbie) said on 9th July 2014, 14:43}
textBeforeTable: 2014 British Grand Prix team radio transcript >> Find out more and sign up Go ad-free for just £1 per month Here are the team radio messages from the British Grand Prix. The decisive moment in the outcome for the battle for victory came when Nico Rosberg retired from the lead on lap 29. His radio messages reveal that before the problem proved terminal his overriding concern was to avoid failing to finish entirely, and find a way of getting the car to the finish to collect some points. Alonso, meanwhile, was livid when Vettel finally got past him on the run into Copse. He said Vettel had only been able to make the move stick because he had run wide, and demanded Vettel be ordered to hand the place back or receive a five-second penalty. Vettel reported Alonso for leaving the track so many times he sounded increasingly bored by it towards the end of their fight. But he became much more animated when he claimed Alonso was not leaving him enough room during their wheel-to-wheel scraps. The pair traded blows over a dozen laps around Silverstone, while simultaneously complaining about their rivals’ driving standards. Alonso was first warned about abusing track limits as early as lap ten, then following a complaint from Jenson Button the
textAfterTable: Lap: Refers to lap message was broadcast on. There may be a delay between messages being said and being broadcast. PR = pre-race; FL = formation lap; VL = victory lap. Message: Repetitive or irrelevant messages omitted. Notes in italics. Highlights in bold. Follow F1 Fanatic Live on Twitter for team radio highlights during all live F1 sessions. Transcription by @WillWood, text by @KeithCollantine.
